Activity: Log in to the system, review emails and calendar for the week. Prioritize tasks based on urgency and importance.
Review project documentation regarding EHR collection and seasonal influenza trend analysis. Focus on understanding the clinical objectives and desired patient care outcomes.

Meet with @clinlead-1 and @rn-1 to discuss clinical priorities for seasonal influenza data collection and how it will impact patient care. Ask for their initial feedback on the current data collection processes.
Research best practices and guidelines for seasonal influenza surveillance and data collection from reputable sources like the CDC and WHO.
Review meeting notes from the morning and identify key action items. Draft an email to @itpm-1 requesting the project meeting schedule for the week.
Contact @his-1 to discuss data quality metrics and how they will be applied to seasonal influenza data. Request information on existing data quality reports.
Document all the reviews and the communications into a structured report. Include areas of concerns and suggestions.
Prepare for tomorrow's meeting by outlining key discussion points and questions. Review relevant documentation again.
Final check on emails and calendar. Prepare for the next day and make sure there are no urgent pending issues.
